definition: serious/in earnest
to compare/to dispute/compared to/(before adj.) relatively/comparatively/rather/also pr. [jiao3]
really/truly/indeed/real/true/genuine
erhua variant of 較真|较真[jiao4 zhen1]

sentences.english: Don't take everything too seriously. It is not worth it.
sentences.chinese: 不要对什么事都较真，它们并不值得你较真。

sentences.english: Don't take everything too seriously. It is not worth it.
sentences.chinese: 不要对什么事都较真，它们并不值得你较真。

sentences.english: As always, we caution readers not to make too much of these findings.
sentences.chinese: 一如往常，我们提醒读者不要对这些发现太较真。

sentences.english: Try to let partners who are getting serious about you down easy or revenge can be expected.
sentences.chinese: 试着让较真儿的对方放松下来，否则会有报复行为哦。

sentences.english: No offense, but don't you think you're a little outmatched ?
sentences.chinese: 我没恶意不过你不觉得你有点太较真了吗？

sentences.english: My new boss is so strict about the rules.
sentences.chinese: 我的新老板对这条规定特别较真儿。

definition: erhua variant of 較真|较真[jiao4 zhen1]
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
lit. to penetrate into a bull's horn (idiom); fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem/to bash one's head against a brick wall/a wild goose chase/a blind alley/to split hairs
to bicker/to argue for the sake of arguing/to carry on poles (together with sb else)/to carry a coffin on poles
obstinate/opinionated
lit. to blow apart the hairs upon a fur to discover any defect (idiom); fig. to be fastidious/nitpick
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
to discuss sth on its own merits/to judge the matter as it stands
to haggle over every cent (idiom)
erhua variant of 較勁|较劲[jiao4 jin4]
to bite words and chew characters (idiom); punctilious about minutiae of wording
to get to the heart of the matter
to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
to go to the bottom of things (idiom)
pinyin: da3 po4 sha1 guo1 wen4 dao4 di3

definition: lit. honing a bull's horn; fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem/to bash one's head against a brick wall/a wild goose chase/a blind alley/to split hairs/same as idiom 鑽牛角尖|钻牛角尖
extreme (usu. of thoughts, speech, circumstances)
